server.facade

Class ServerFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.facade.ServerFacade

  • public class ServerFacade
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade of the server to make all operations to an specific game.
    Author:
    raulvillalpando

        password - The user's password (case-sensitive)

      • gameList

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement gameList()

      • createNewGame

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement createNewGame(java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.Boolean randomTiles,
                                        java.lang.Boolean randomNumbers,
                                        java.lang.Boolean randomPorts)
                                          throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Creates and returns a new game.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new game.
        randomTiles - Boolean describing if the new game should have random tile locations.
        randomNumbers - Boolean describing if the new game should have the numbers randomly allocated on the map.
        randomPorts - Boolean describing if the location of the ports should be random on the new game.
        Returns:
        A newly created game.
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • joinGame

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement joinGame(java.lang.Integer gameId,
                                   java.lang.String color,
                                   java.lang.Integer userID)
                                     throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Adds (or re-adds) the player to the specified game
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to join
        color - The color of the player for the game to join. Should not be taken by another player already.
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • gameSave

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement gameSave(java.lang.Integer gameId,
                                   java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to save.
        fileName - The file name you want to save it under
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • gameLoad

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement gameLoad(java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the saved game file that you want to load. (The game's ID is restored as well.)
        Returns:
        The game that was previously saved.
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • getModel

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement getModel(int version,
                                   java.lang.Integer gameId)
                                     throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Return the model
        Parameters:
        version - The version number of the model that the caller already has. It goes up by one for each command that is applied. If you send this parameter, you will get a model back only if the current model is newer than the specified version number. Otherwise, it returns the string "true" to notify the caller that it already has the current model state.
        game - The game from which the model comes from.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(java.lang.String command,
              int gameId)

      • getCommands

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement getCommands(int gameId)

      • resetGame

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement resetGame(int gameId)
                                      throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        For the default games created by the server, this method reverts the game to the state immediately after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method reverts the game to the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round). This method returns the client model JSON for the game after it has been reset.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to reset.
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • sendChat

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement sendChat(int gameId,
                                   java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                   java.lang.String message)
                                     throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Sends a chat message
        Parameters:
        gameThe - game were the chat belongs to
        playerIndexThe - index of the sender
        message - The message of the chat
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel)
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement rollNumber(int gameId,
                                     java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                     java.lang.Integer rolledNumber)
                                       throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Used to roll a number at the beginning of your turn
        Parameters:

        playerIndex - The index of the player who rolled

      • robPlayer

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement robPlayer(int gameId,
                                    java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                    java.lang.Integer victimIndex,
                                    HexLocation location,
                                    java.lang.Boolean soldierCard)
                                      throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Moves the robber, selecting the new robber position and player to rob.
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the robbing is taking place.
        playerIndex - The index of the player robbing.
        victimIndex - The index of the player being robbed.
        location - The Location where the robber will be placed.
        soldierCard - Whether or not the robbing took place with a soldier card or not
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel)
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • buildRoad

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement buildRoad(int gameId,
                                    java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                    EdgeLocation roadLocation,
                                    java.lang.Boolean free)
                                      throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Builds a road at the specified location. (Set 'free' to true during initial setup.)
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the road will be placed
        playerIndex - The index of the player who is placing the road.
        roadLocation - The location where the road will be placed.
        free - Whether or not the road is build for free
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel)
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • buildSettlement

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement buildSettlement(int gameId,
                                          java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                          VertexLocation vertexLocation,
                                          java.lang.Boolean free)
                                            throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Builds a settlement at the specified location. (Set 'free' to true during initial setup.)
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the settlement will be placed
        playerIndex - The index of the player who is placing the settlement.
        vertexLocation - The vertex location where the settlement will be placed.
        free - Whether or not the settlement will be placed for free.
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel)
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • offerTrade

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement offerTrade(int gameId,
                                     java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                     java.lang.Integer receiver,
                                     ResourceCardDeck senderDeck,
                                     ResourceCardDeck receiverDeck)
                                       throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Offers a domestic trade to another player.
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the offer will be made
        playerIndex - The index of the player placing the offer.
        receiver - The index of the player receiving the offer.
        senderDeck - The deck of resources that the sender is giving.
        receiverDeck - the deck of resources that the receiver is giving in return.
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel).
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • acceptTrade

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement acceptTrade(int gameId,
                                      java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                      java.lang.Boolean accept)
                                        throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Used to accept or reject a trade offered to you.
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the trade was made
        playerIndex - The index of the player rejecting/accepting the trade.
        accept - Whether or not the player is accepting the trade.
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel).
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

      • maritimeTrade

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement maritimeTrade(int gameId,
                                        java.lang.Integer playerIndex,
                                        java.lang.Integer ratio,
                                        ResourceType sendingResource,
                                        ResourceType receivingResource)
                                          throws ServerInvalidRequestException
        Used to execute a maritime trade.
        Parameters:
        game - The game where the trade will be made.
        playerIndex - The index of the player making the offer.
        ratio - The ratio of the trading (Ex. 3:1, 2:1, 4:1).
        sendingResource - The resource type being offered.
        receivingResource - The resource type being received.
        Returns:
        Returns the client model (identical to getModel).
        Throws:
        ServerInvalidRequestException

        playerIndex - The index of the player discarding cards.
